channel.title: My Servers PROBLEMS
channel.description:
I cant compile and i need to i am trying to make a private server
PROBLEMS-
Cant Compile (i have the latest java)
if u can help thanks
----------

item.title: My Servers PROBLEMS
item.dc:creator: @barelypassing barelypassing
item.description:
@barelypassing wrote:

It’s probably an issue with his compiler’s code.

Read full topic

item.title: My Servers PROBLEMS
item.dc:creator: @shayd3e shayd3e
item.description:
@shayd3e wrote:

[quote=“resident123, post:6, topic:37632”]Try this it should work

@echo off
@TITLE [ Server Name Here ]
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit[/quote]
Dude how can you solve a problem without knowing it.
He is not telling us any information about the error when he compiles
It might be an error because he coded something wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: My Servers PROBLEMS
item.dc:creator: @resident123 resident123
item.description:
@resident123 wrote:

Try this it should work

@echo off
@TITLE [ Server Name Here ]
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

Read full topic

item.title: My Servers PROBLEMS
item.dc:creator: @_Urban !.::Urban.::!
item.description:
@_Urban wrote:

Right click Compile, and Edit it.
You’ll see a Java Version in there, edit it to your Java Version
So if you have Java Verison 14, then change it to Java … 14

Read full topic

is it a 508?

if it is then go to cmd file, then right click compile, press edit, you will see something like 6_07 right?

change the 07 with the udate of jdk you have
